title: Transferring health policy knowledge: lessons for England from health system reform in Europe
abstractText:
This project aims to give policy makers in England, particularly senior staff working in the National Health Service (NHS), the opportunity to learn from health system reform in Europe through a series of three seminars organised jointly by LSE Health, a large multi-disciplinary research centre, and the NHS Confederation, a body representing NHS organisations. At each seminar, leading experts will share their experience of lessons learnt from specific reforms in European countries to inform policy makers in England as they embark on a series of reforms intended to improve the performance of the NHS and the health of the English population.

The project brings together academics and practitioners to facilitate knowledge transfer, networking and research collaboration at a time when the English health system is preparing for major reform. It also offers learning opportunities for LSE Health staff and PhD students.
organisation: London School of Economics & Pol Sci
